abstract.para: This is the documentation for the RESTful APIs exposed through the World of Warcraft community site as a service to the World of Warcraft community.

preface.title: Introduction
preface.para: The Blizzard Community Platform API provides a number of resources for developers and Wow enthusiasts to gather data about their characters, guilds and arena teams. This documentation is primarily for developers and third parties.

Blizzard's epic gaming experiences often take place in game, but can lead to rewarding and lasting experiences out of game as well. Through exposing key sets of data, we can enable the community to create extended communities to continue that epic experience.

chapter.title: Features
chapter.para: Before getting started with the Community Platform API, programmers must first understand how the API is organized and how it works. The following sections provide a high level overview of the features of this API. It is recommended that the reader have knowledge of the HTTP protocol as well as a general understanding of web technologies.

section.title: REST
section.para: The API is mostly RESTful. Data is exposed in the form of URIs that represent resources and can be fetched with HTTP clients (like web browsers). At this time, the API is limited to read-only operations.
The character and guild API resources do honor HTTP requests that contain the "Last-Modified" header.

section.title: Access and Regions
section.para: To access the API, HTTP requests can be made to specific URLs and resources exposed on the regional Battle.net domains.

example.title: An example API request and response.

section.para:
The regions where this API is available are:
us.battle.net
eu.battle.net
kr.battle.net
tw.battle.net
battlenet.com.cn

The data available through the API is limited to the region that it is in. Hence, US APIs accessed through us.battle.net will only contain data within US battlegroups and realms. Support for locales is limited to those supported on the World of Warcraft community sites.

section.title: Throttling
section.para: Consumers of the API can make a limited number of requests per day, as stated in the API Policy and Terms of Use. For anonymous consumers of the API, the number of requests that can be made per day is set to 3,000. Once that threshold is reached, depending on site activity and performance, subsequent requests may be denied. High limits are available to registered applications.

section.title: Authentication
section.para: Although most of the application can be accessed without any form of authentication, we do support a form application registration and authentication. Application authentication involves creating and including an application identifier and a request signature and including those values with the request headers.
The primary benefit to making requests as an authenticated application is that you can make more requests per day.

section.title: Application Registration
section.para: To send authenticated request you first need to register an application. Because registration isn't automated, application registration is limited to those who meet the following criteria:

listitem.para: You plan on making requests from one or more IP addresses. (e.g. a production environment and development environment)
You can justify making more than 2,000 requests per day from one or more IP addresses.

section.para: Registering an application is a matter of providing a description of the application, how you plan on using the API and your contact information to api-support@blizzard.com with the subject "Application Registration Request". Once we receive your request, we will contact you to either provide additional information or with application keys to use.

section.title: Authentication Process
section.para: To authenticate a request, simple include the "Authorization" header with your application identifier and the request signature.

example.title: An example authenticated request
example.programlisting: GET /api/wow/character/Medivh/Thrall HTTP/1.1 Host: us.battle.net Date: Fri, 10 Jun 2011 20:59:24 GMT Authorization: BNET c1fbf21b79c03191d:+3fE0RaKc+PqxN0gi8va5GQC35A=

section.para: In the above exmple, the value of the Authorization header has three parts "BNET", "c1fbf21b79c03191d" and "+3fE0RaKc+PqxN0gi8va5GQC35A=". The first part is a processing directive for the Authorization header. The second and third values are the application public key and the request signature. section.title: Formats and Protocols
section.para: Data returned in the response message is provided in JSON format. Please refer to the examples provided with each API section for additional information.

section.title: Error Handling
section.para: Although several of the API resources have specific error responses that correspond to specific situations, there are several generic error responses that you should be aware of.

Errors are returned as JSON objects that contain "status" and "reason" attributes. The value of the "status" attribute will always be "nok". The reason will be an english string that may be, but is not limited to, one of the following strings.

listitem.para: HTTP Response Code: 500
A request was made including application identification information, but either the application key is invalid or missing.
HTTP Response Code: 500
A request was made to an API resource that requires a higher application permission level.
HTTP Response Code: 500
The application or IP address has been blocked from making further requests. This ban may not be permanent.

varlistentry.term: When in doubt, blow it up. (page not found)

listitem.para: HTTP Response Code: 404
A request was made to a resource that doesn't exist.

varlistentry.term: If at first you don't succeed, blow it up again. (too many requests)

listitem.para: HTTP Response Code: 500
The application or IP has been throttled.

varlistentry.term: Have you not been through enough? Will you continue to fight what you cannot defeat? (something unexpected happened)

listitem.para: HTTP Response Code: 500
There was a server error or equally catastrophic exception preventing the request from being fulfilled.
HTTP Response Code: 500
The application authorization information was mallformed or missing when expected.
HTTP Response Code: 500
The application request signature was missing or invalid. This will also be thrown if the request date outside of a 15 second window from the current GMT time.

section.title: Support
section.para: For questions about the API, please use the Community Platform API forums as a platform to ask questions and get help.
You can also email api-support@blizzard.com for matters that you may not want public discussion for.

section.title: Character Resources
section.para: Character APIs currently provide character profile information.

section.title: Profile
section.para: The Character Profile API is the primary way to access character information. This Character Profile API can be used to fetch a single character at a time through an HTTP GET request to a URL describing the character profile resource. By default, a basic dataset will be returned and with each request and zero or more additional fields can be retrieved. To access this API, craft a resource URL pointing to the character whos information is to be retrieved.
section.programlisting:
URL = Host + "/api/wow/character/" + Realm + "/" + CharacterName
Realm = <proper realm name> | <normalized realm name>
section.para: There are no required query string parameters when accessing this resource, although the "fields" query string parameter can optionally be passed to indicate that one or more of the optional datasets is to be retrieved. Those additional fields are listed in the subsection titled "Optional Fields".

example.title: An example Character Profile API request and response.

section.para: The core dataset returned includes the character's realm, name, level, last modified timestamp, thumbnail, race id, achievement points value, gender id and class id.

section.title: Optional Fields
section.para: This section contains a list of the optional fields that can be requested through the mentioned "fields" query string parameter.

listitem.para: A summary of the guild that the character belongs to. If the character does not belong to a guild and this field is requested, this field will not be exposed.
A map of character attributes and stats.
A list of talent structures.
A list of items equipted by the character. Use of this field will also include the average item level and average item level equipped for the character.
A list of the factions that the character has an associated reputation with.
A list of the titles obtained by the character including the currently selected title.
A list of the character's professions. It is important to note that when this information is retrieved, it will also include the known recipes of each of the listed professions.
A map of values that describes the face, features and helm/cloak display preferences and attributes.
A list of all of the non-combat pets obtained by the character.
A list of all of the mounts obtained by the character.
A list of all of the combat pets obtained by the character.
A map of achievement data including completion timestamps and criteria information.
A list of raids and bosses indicating raid progression and completedness.

example.title: An example Character Profile request with several addtional fields.

section.title: guild
section.para: When a guild is requested, a map is returned with key/value pairs that describe a basic set of guild information. Note that the rank of the character is not included in this block as it describes a guild and not a membership of the guild. To retreive the character's rank within the guild, you must specific a seperate request to the guild profile resource.

section.title: items
section.para: When the items field is used, a map structure is returned that contains information on the equipped items of that character as well as the average item level of the character.

section.title: Guild Resources
section.para: Guild APIs currently provide guild profile information.

section.title: Profile API
section.para: The guild profile API is the primary way to access guild information. This guild profile API can be used to fetch a single guild at a time through an HTTP GET request to a url describing the guild profile resource. By default, a basic dataset will be returned and with each request and zero or more additional fields can be retrieved. To access this API, craft a resource URL pointing to the guild whos information is to be retrieved.
section.programlisting:
URL = Host + "/api/wow/guild/" + Realm + "/" + GuildName
Realm = <proper realm name> | <normalized realm name>
section.para: There are no required query string parameters when accessing this resource, although the "fields" query string parameter can optionally be passed to indicate that one or more of the optional datasets is to be retrieved. Those additional fields are listed in the subsection titled "Optional Fields".

example.title: An example Guild Profile request and response.

section.para: The core dataset returned includes the guild's name, level, faction and achievement points.

section.title: Optional Fields
section.para: This section contains a list of the optional fields that can be requested.

listitem.para: A list of characters that are a member of the guild
A set of data structures that describe the achievements earned by the guild.

example.title: An example Guild Profile request with several addtional fields.

section.title: members
section.para: When the members list is requrested, a list of character objects is returned. Each object in the returned members list contains a character block as well as a rank field.

section.title: achievements
section.para: When requesting achievement data, several sets of data will be returned.

listitem.para: A list of achievement ids.
A list of timestamps whose places correspond to the achievement ids in the "achievementsCompleted" list. The value of each timestamp indicates when the related achievement was earned by the guild.
A list of criteria ids that can be used to determine the partial completedness of guild achievements.
A list of values associated with a given achievement criteria. The position of a value corresponds to the position of a given achivement criteria.
A list of timestamps where the value represents when the criteria was considered complete. The position of a value corresponds to the position of a given achivement criteria.
A list of timestamps where the value represents when the criteria was considered started. The position of a value corresponds to the position of a given achivement criteria.

section.title: Realm Resources
section.para: Realm APIs currently provide realm status information.

section.title: Realm Status
section.para: The realm status API allows developers to retrieve realm status information. This information is limited to whether or not the realm is up, the type and state of the realm and the current population.
There are no required query string parameters when accessing this resource, although the "realms" query string parameter can optionally be passed to limit the realms returned to one or more.

example.title: An example Realm Status request and response

section.title: Auction Resources
section.para: Auction APIs currently provide rolling batches of data about current auctions. Fetching auction dumps is a two step process that involves checking a per-realm index file to determine if a recent dump has been generated and then fetching the most recently generated dump file if necessary.

section.title: Current Auctions APIs
section.para: This API resource provides a per-realm list of recently generated auction house data dumps.
There are no required query string parameters when accessing this resource.

example.title: An example Current Auctions request and response

section.title: Current Auctions Data
section.para: The current auctions data is represented as JSON structures containing auction data for the tree auctions houses available on each realm.

section.title: Data Resources
section.para: The data APIs provide information that can compliment profile information to provide structure, definition and context.

section.title: Character Races
section.para: The character races data API provides a list of character races.

section.title: Character Classes
section.para: The character classes data API provides a list of character classes.

section.title: Guild Rewards
section.para: The guild rewards data API provides a list of all guild rewards.

section.title: Guild Perks
section.para: The guild perks data API provides a list of all guild perks.

section.title: Items
section.para: The items data API provides detailed item information.

chapter.title: API Policy
chapter.para: The final policy document is being reviewed and will be published at a later date.

question.para: Is there an official library or reference implementation provided with these web APIs?

answer.para: No, Blizzard Entertainment has not released an officially support client library to consume the web APIs. There are a number of unofficial libraries that follow the spec provided by this documentation. You are not limited to or forced to use one of the libraries below and can create your own.

listitem.para: https://github.com/vishnevskiy/battlenet

answer.para: We decided to roll out JSON for numerous reasons. One of the main reasons is that it allows developers and website operators to easily embed requests that consume this date into their websites.
